page.title: 12A Solihull Doctor's Surgery
page.content: We paid a visit to a local{doctor's {surgery.}In it there were five doctors, five receptionists, a secretary, a cleaner and a manager. Their youngest patient was a new-born baby and their oldest was 100 years old. The doctors prescribe drugs and medicines to make people better. If they don't know what is wrong with people they refer them to specialists at the{hospital.} We were told that more women than men visit the doctor; more old people than young people; more babies than children. The busiest day was Monday and the quietest day was Wednesday. Coughs and colds were the most common complaint. Many leaflets were available at the surgery telling people how they could stay healthy.
